attributes.action: Allow 16-17 year olds to be given a covid vaccine
attributes.additional_details:
Many 17 year olds are going to university in September and do not turn 18 until august. This means that there is very little time for them to have received a coronavirus vaccine prior to them starting at university. As a result, they may not have had time to develop a significant enough immune response to prevent them catching and spreading the virus. This could lead to large outbreaks in universities and surrounding areas. 
The mental well-being of 16-17 year olds has been seriously impacted by the effects of lockdowns on socialising which can help prevent a deterioration in mental well-being. By vaccinating this age group individuals will be able to socialise more safely and their well-being will improve.
attributes.background: Ask all 16-17 year olds to get their covid vaccine in the same way the government has for all other eligible age groups.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/589254
